{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3123997,"name":"joemost","username":"joemost","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/joemost/{size}/11114_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-12T05:01:57.111Z","cooked":"

Iâ€™m going to embrace all thee awesome geometry classes this year such as Pose2D.

I know Field2D displays nicely in the Simulator and you can set your robot pose. Is there any other way to plot stuff? Would love to plot a bunch of pose2d objectâ€™s and see where my vision system thinks I am!

i had the same need awhile ago, specifically to see where the robot thinks the apriltags are, so i wrote a driver station dashboard to show it. itâ€™s very simple. you can see it here:

GitHub

GitHub - truher/radar: Demo of Network Tables support for MessagePack: a...

Demo of Network Tables support for MessagePack: a dashboard for AprilTags. - GitHub - truher/radar: Demo of Network Tables support for MessagePack: a dashboard for AprilTags.

it also uses the new network tables structured-payload feature using MessagePack, so not exactly Pose2d (because I wanted the ability to show other fields, for example, detection confidence).

feedback and pull requests welcome!
